Package webcommunication.time

Class TimeSynchronizationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • webcommunication.time.TimeSynchronizationManager
  • public class TimeSynchronizationManager
extends Object
    Responsible for the synchronization of server time and client time.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static Duration MIN_EXPECTED_CALCULATION_TIME  
      private Duration serverTimeOffset  
      private static int TIME_API_REQUESTS  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TimeSynchronizationManager()
      Creates a new TimeSynchronizationManager without a connection to a TimeAPIClient.
      TimeSynchronizationManager​(TimeAPIClient timeApiClient)
      Creates a new TimeSynchronizationManager which initially synchronizes the local client time with the server time.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      IDeadline createDeadline​(ZonedDateTime deadlineTime)
      Creates a new IDeadline which is synchronized with the server.
      private void initializeOffsetAndBuffer​(TimeAPIClient timeApiClient)
      Initializes the time offset and buffer by sending requests multiple with the given TimeAPIClient.
      private void resync​(ZonedDateTime deadlineTime)
      Synchronizes the client with the server with a given deadline.

        private static final int TIME_API_REQUESTS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • serverTimeOffset

        private Duration serverTimeOffset

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeSynchronizationManager

        public TimeSynchronizationManager​(TimeAPIClient timeApiClient)
        Creates a new TimeSynchronizationManager which initially synchronizes the local client time with the server time. The created TimeSynchronizationManager can then be used to create Deadlines which can be used on the client side.
        Parameters:
        timeApiClient - TimeAPIClient to get the server time from

      • TimeSynchronizationManager

        public TimeSynchronizationManager()
        Creates a new TimeSynchronizationManager without a connection to a TimeAPIClient. This results in an unsynchronized behavior and is not recommended.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeOffsetAndBuffer

        private void initializeOffsetAndBuffer​(TimeAPIClient timeApiClient)
                                throws TimeRequestException
        Initializes the time offset and buffer by sending requests multiple with the given TimeAPIClient. The response with the shortest response time is chosen to calculate the time offset and buffer.
        Parameters:
        timeApiClient - the TimeAPIClient to send requests with
        Throws:
        TimeRequestException - thrown when no requests could be sent

      • resync

        private void resync​(ZonedDateTime deadlineTime)
        Synchronizes the client with the server with a given deadline. New Synchronizations are forced, when an impossible deadline has been received.
        Parameters:
        deadlineTime - the ZonedDateTime of the deadline

      • createDeadline

        public IDeadline createDeadline​(ZonedDateTime deadlineTime)
        Creates a new IDeadline which is synchronized with the server.
        Parameters:
        deadlineTime - ZonedDateTime of the deadline on the server
        Returns:
        IDeadline which can be used on the client
